name: Linear0
body:
### Linear0
Linear0 is a program made by volunteers that assists with bypassing the extremely restrictive firewall employed by the DET/DEC.
The current version is: **0.2.1**

### How can I use this?
Download Linear0 using the link above. 
Simply open Linear0.exe and type in your DEC credentials. The application will launch and automatically configure Internet Explorer, Google Chrome and Windows Store Applications. 

You may need to configure Mozilla Firefox (or other applications) in the following way:

Options -> Advanced -> Network -> (Connection) Settings

![Firefox Proxy Settings Image](https://linear0.edublogs.org/files/2015/03/proxy_settings_firefox-13wyhda.png)

- Host: 127.0.0.1
- Port: 8118

### Features:
- Fast!
- Easy to use!
- Multiple Servers, constantly updated!
- Bypass DEC internet restrictions!

### Current Servers:
Sydney1: Sydney, Australia
Arizona1: Arizona, US
Seattle1: Seattle, US

### Servers Coming Soon:
- 11/03/2015 - Singapore, South-East Asia
- 11/03/2015 - Los Angeles, US

### Live Server Bandwidth Usage:
**Coming Soon**
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
